Dear Sirs,

I am writing to lodge a complaint against CX's decision of firing two pilots for leaking information and taking disciplinary actions against staff.

It is strongly believed that staff can participate in political activities that have no conflict with their roles. However, CX also told staff not to post anything on social media nor join any protests warned that there would be disciplinary actions for employees who support or participate in any of protests or movements. This has led to very low morale among staff as staff are worried that they would be the next one to receive penalties or termination of employments.

We are deeply disappointed at CX as it deprives staff of their right to express their views or joining any legal activities or rally outside their working hours. This is definitely creating white terror.

We are afraid we could not continue to fly with CX in future which has obviously differs greatly from the views of mainstream. In this event, CX has completely destroyed our confidence.

We sincerely hope you would withdraw the sacking of the two pilots and promise not to take any action against any staff relating to the protests and demand you would try your best to protect your staff but not to give up on them.

We look forward to your reply.

Yours sincerely,
A citizen who cares aviation safety but cares freedom of speech much more
